Sayings.Name: Break
Sayings.Description: Show an example of a break in text
Sayings.SpeechText: I will return after this short four second break <break time="4s"/>  Fear not for I have returned

Sayings.Name: Emphasis
Sayings.Description: Demonstrate emphasis on a specific section of text.
Sayings.SpeechText: I don't just love tacos, I mean I really <emphasis level="strong">love</emphasis> tacos

Sayings.Name: Paragraph
Sayings.SpeechText:
I'm going to talk about my first topic and pause when I'm done.

Now we are are on the second paragraph. You should have noticed the pause between the paragraphs

Sayings.Name: Telephone Number
Sayings.Notes: For more info see - https://developer.amazon.com/docs/custom-skills/speech-synthesis-markup-language-ssml-reference.html#phoneme . Song : 867-5309 by Tommy Tutone
Sayings.SpeechText: Jenny I've got your number. I need to make you mine. Jenny don't change your number. <say-as interpret-as="telephone">8675309</say-as>.

Sayings.Name: phonetic
Sayings.Description: Demonstarate phonetic pronunciation that alexa can do
Sayings.SpeechText: You say, <phoneme alphabet="ipa" ph="pɪˈkɑːn">pecan</phoneme>. I say, <phoneme alphabet="ipa" ph="ˈpi.kæn">pecan</phoneme>.

Sayings.Name: Speech Prosody
Sayings.Description: Demonstrate the functionality that control speech rate, voice pitch and speech volume.
Sayings.SpeechText: I can change the rate of speech like this. <prosody rate="x-fast">I can go fast like this </prosody> or <prosody rate="x-slow"> Slow like this</prosody>. I can change the pitch of my voice <prosody pitch="x-high">to be really high like this </prosody> or <prosody pitch="x-low"> really low like this</prosody>. Finally I can change how loud I say something. I can be <prosody volume="x-loud"> really loud like this </prosody> or <prosody volume="x-soft"> really soft like this </prosody>.

Sayings.Name: Sentence
Sayings.SpeechText:
I can speak in sentences.

When I do there will be short pauses between them.

This helps them to sound more natural and to flow better.

Sayings.Name: Spell out
Sayings.Description: Demonstrate how to make alexa spell something out
Sayings.SpeechText: <s>Let's spell out some words. The word is Mississippi and it is spelled <say-as interpret-as="spell-out">Mississippi</say-as></s>. <s>The final word is handkerchief and it is spelled <say-as interpret-as="spell-out">handkerchief</say-as> .</s>

Sayings.Name: Numbers
Sayings.Description: Demonstrate Alexa's ability to deal with numbers
Sayings.SpeechText: This is a cardinal number <say-as interpret-as="cardinal">152</say-as> and this is an ordinal order <say-as interpret-as="ordinal">152</say-as> and this is digit by digit <say-as interpret-as="digits">152</say-as>

Sayings.Name: Substitute
Sayings.SpeechText: Here are some examples from the periodic table of elements. Some of the poor metals are <sub alias="aluminum">Al</sub>, <sub alias="Zinc">Zn</sub>, <sub alias="Tin">Sn</sub>, and <sub alias="Lead">Pb</sub>. Let's say them again, Al, Zn, Sn and Pb.

Sayings.Name: Word Example
Sayings.SpeechText: The word, <say-as interpret-as="characters">read</say-as>, may be interpreted as either the present simple form, <w role="amazon:VB">read</w>, or the past participle form, <w role="amazon:VBD">read</w>.
